---
title: "run"
description: "Run the workflow using the specified version and variables"
---



If no version is provided, the latest version is used.

```python
workflow = notte.Workflow("<your-workflow-id>")
workflow.run(variable1="value1", variable2="value2", local=True)
```

> Make sure that the correct variables are provided based on the python file previously uploaded. Otherwise, the workflow will fail.

You can use `local=True` to run the workflow locally


## Parameters

<ParamField path="version" type="UnionType[str, None]" default="None">
</ParamField>

<ParamField path="local" type="bool" default="False">
</ParamField>

<ParamField path="restricted" type="bool" default="True">
</ParamField>

<ParamField path="timeout" type="UnionType[int, None]" default="None">
</ParamField>

<ParamField path="raise_on_failure" type="bool" default="True">
</ParamField>

<ParamField path="workflow_run_id" type="UnionType[str, None]" default="None">
</ParamField>

<ParamField path="variables" type="Any" required>
</ParamField>

## Returns

[`WorkflowRunResponse`](/sdk-reference/misc/workflowrunresponse)
